4428031/4370129/4475275.title: Cure for Thorn in Any Part of the Body
4428031/4370129/4475275.text:
It is believed locally that a fox can take a thorn out of any part of his own body by licking the part affected with his tongue.It is also believed that if any person licks the tongue of a live fox with his own tongue that the person also will have the power of removing thorns by the application of his tongue to the part affected.Anthony Kearney of Steelaun (now an old age pensioner) has this power. If anybody has a thorn in any part of his body and it is difficult to remove with a pin or a needle he goes to old Anthony who just rubs his

One day he caught a fox, brought him home alive and licked his tongue, on the advice of a portsman who happened to be in his house when he returned.Anthony is still alive and performs the cure to this day.

4493722/4414131/4527823.text:

One day when I was out walking with a friend he got a thorn in his finger.  When he came home, his father put the sap of the root of an orange lily on top of the place where the thorn was.  This drew out the thorn.

4605935/4603798/4643746.title: The Cure of the Thorn
4605935/4603798/4643746.text:
The old people of this district have great confidence in cures and there are still many of them preserved. In most cases those cures prove a success. One of them is the cure of the thorn. Patrick McPartlan of Moneenatieve, Drumkeeran has this cure. He got it from his aunt and it has been handed down from one generation to another and it can only be handed from a woman to a man and then from that man to a woman. It is part of the charm not to tell the prayers to anybody. When he says the necessary prayer he makes the sign of the cross and after a few days the thorn comes out. Patrick McPartlan is about sixty four or sixty five years of age now. Last year a little boy from Arigna had a very sore foot owing to a bad thorn which he got in crossing a fence. It remained in his foot for a month and when his parents could find no other remedy they sent him to Patrick McPartlan and when he made the cure
(continues on next page)

The old woman would take the tongue & put it round the boy's leg & leave it there some time. Then she would remove it & the thorn would be in the tongue. (R.Foley)
